Comments_List: I developed a better way to talk about art and express my ideas. I had to learn how to print and bind and adapt these to my different ideas.
I learned how to communicate effectively through design decisions.

Professor Chung was extremely engaged with the course and would let us send her PDFs of our work for suggestions. I could tell she really cared about our work and development. I wish we could have had some time during class to work. There was a really expectation for us so I was pushed to make my best work.
KEEP THE CLASS SIZE SMALL! My class had only five people in it, and it was PERFECT!
Yes definitely. It has been my favorite class Ive taken at Yale so far.

YES - ALICE CHUNG IS THE GREATEST DESIGN PROFESSOR YOU WILL EVER HAVE PROBABLY. She is patient, inspiring, helpful, and kind. She will actually inspire you to pursue design in the future, as long as you put in the work for the course and take it seriously.

Yes! Really fun, loved all of the content
Would have liked more feedback on the thirteen hundred rats assignment.

Paper and printing are so expensive! Art classes are so expensive to take, there's a 150$ fee, and I definitely spent more than 80$ on printing this semester :(
